accomplishments:
(6 months




- Setting up the FORGE portfolio teams with a strategy, roadmap and goals broken down with a short, medium and long term vision.
Maintained and advocated for the focus on driving towards an outcome in production despite this not being the primary goal of the client and pushback from different sources internally. Impact on Rise8 - This sets up Rise8 to be able to continue to pursue outcomes in prod for FORGE despite the setbacks in account setups that are still needed to get to production




- Coaching the FORGE cyber team:
From - A team with no effective planning, goals or backlog to milestones aligned with FORGE priorities.
To - Agile ceremonies running weekly - standup, IPM, retro. Epics and milestones now aligned with the portfolio priorities. Prioritized phases of cyber work aligned to the production outcomes goals and beyond. Cyber team now has a leader enabled in PM principles to carry this work forward.
Impact on Rise8 - This has accelerated the ability for Rise8 and the FORGE program to deliver outcomes in production as soon as possible by getting the necessary cyber work planned and executed in as short a time as possible.
enps_comments:
**Adam Gardner:**
I worked with David for five months as a peer. Despite the engagement being a difficult situation that wasn't always conducive to success, I found David to be an extremely talented and pragmatic Staff PM. They are a massive asset that Rise8 should leverage on complex engagements

**Kevin Gates:**
David is one of the best PMs I've worked with. He is calm under pressure, has a keen product sense and is a great communicator, whether he is talking to teammates or clients.

**Jeremy Steinbeck:**
In an effort to balance customer needs with completing a large number of reviews, I am prioritizing written feedback for the people I worked most closely with this year
start_stop_keep:

Keep: Breaking down silos and bringing strategic vision through clear roadmaps and other artifacts. Being a collaborator by default. Having a good product sense. 
Stop: Nothing really comes to mind. 
Start: Sharing with others how to define complex roadmaps and how to collaborate across disciplines.
